etymologies: late Old English truht, from late Latin tructa, based on Greek trōgein ‘gnaw’

definitions: a chiefly freshwater fish of the salmon family, found in both Eurasia and North America and highly valued as food and game.

notes.text: Genera Salmo (several species of true trouts, including the European brown trout and the rainbow trout), and Salvelinus (several North American species), family Salmonidae. See also lake trout, sea trout

shortDefinitions: chiefly freshwater fish of salmon family
